snippet.title: Darius+ - Atari ST [047] PlayThru
snippet.description:
Blog Entry for this Capture - https://www.retroplaythrus.com/2020/02/darius-atari-st-047-playthru.html
Twitter - https://twitter.com/RetroPlaythrus

NOTE: A trainer was used for making this capture.

Darius+ is a side scroller shoorter, with beautiful and colorful graphics, sound effects and music, and decent playability.

What is wrong with the gameplay?  The game runs a little sluggish on the stock Atari ST, in my opinion.  But that is literally the only real detraction.  Otherwise, the programmers did an outstanding job, utilizing the ST's palette for all of the art.  I should try this game on the Atari Falcon and see how it performs, or maybe even on a Mega STe with its 16 Mhz CPU.

Darius+ level layout is similar to Out Run in style in that at the end of each stage the player can choose one of two paths. There are 21 total levels, but to reach the end, a player only needs to complete six levels.  To actually play every stage in the game, a gamer would need to play through the game six times.

      x     
     x x    
    x x x   
   x x x x  
  x x x x x
 x x x x x x

Except for the sluggishness mentioned above, Darius+ is a pretty nice shooter on the ST.

Capture info -

This video was captured on January 12, 2020.

Game was played on an Atari 1040 STf, TOS 1.4, 1MB, equipped with a CosmosEX from Jookie.
A Best Electronics ST Monitor to VGA cable was used, connected to an OSSC 1.6 (processing the video in Line4x mode), with the output being captured by a Startech USB3HDCAP.

Video was edited with Shotcut.
